structure.unit: KENTUCKY ALCOHOL AND OTHER DRUG ABUSE PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, AND TREATMENT LAW

law.catch_line: Pilot projects for services to prevent smoking and substance abuse during pregnancy -- Funding.

text.section: The Cabinet for Health and Family Services may establish four (4) or more pilot projects within the Commonwealth to demonstrate the effectiveness of different methods of providing community services to prevent smoking and alcohol and substance abuse by pregnant females; improving agency coordination to better identify the pregnant smoker and substance abuser and other females who have smoking and substance abuse problems; linking with community services and treatment for the chemically dependent woman, her children, and other family members; and gaining access to early intervention services for infants in need.
The cabinet may use any state appropriation and any gifts, grants, or federal funds that become available for the purposes of implementing the provisions of this section.

law.history: Amended 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 99, sec. 559, effective June 20, 2005. -- Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 536, sec. 29, effective July 14, 2000. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 426, sec. 500, effective July 15, 1998. -- Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 442, sec. 5, effective July 14, 1992.
